page.title: 06LIVESTOCK FARMING-S.CREAKE
page.content: Livestock features permanently on only two farms. One has sheep, the pigs and both have suckler cows for beef production. These utilize some permanent pasture (one meadow being an historic site), some areas of light land and water meadows. One of the larger farms owned by a company only diversifies into beef production when the trade is profitable. Livestock makes extra demands upon the labour force and the wages bill unless the farmer himself is prepared to be stockman during weekends, nights and holidays. In consequence the large farms prefer the more comfortable arable farming on their acres. The sheep are sold at local markets and the pigs to a national supermarket chain.
